Package patchwork

Class Player

java.lang.Object
patchwork.Player
public class Player extends Object
A representation of a player in the Patchwork game. Each player has a patchwork, a name, a number of buttons, a position on the time board, a flag to indicate if they have finished their turn, and a time remaining.

  • Constructor Summary

    Creates a new player with the specified name and patchwork.

      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the cost is negative or exceeds the player's buttons.

    • advanceAndReceiveButtons

      public int advanceAndReceiveButtons(Player other, TimeBoard timeBoard)
      Advances the player's position on the time board by moving to the other player's position plus one, and receives one button for each space moved.
      Parameters:
      other - The other player.
      timeBoard - The time board of the game.
      Returns:
      The number of special patches to place.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if either other or timeBoard is null.

    • openPatch

      public boolean openPatch(Patch patch)
      Checks if a certain patch is available to the player.
      Parameters:
      patch - The patch to check.
      Returns:
      True if the patch is available, false otherwise.
